column5: Here's a link to a story outta the U.K. about a carp angler who caught the same fish, twice, a year apart and re-setting his own record! http://www.thesun.co.uk/article/0,,2-2006560230,00.html (I'm technically challenged, so just copy the link... enjoy!) HH
Thanks so much I.F! Much appreciated! I guess I'm not as inept as I thought! HH

It was a pretty bad article with very little detail, but it looks like there will be a video of the new record released tomorrow sometime.  The text below is from http://anglingtimes.blogspot.com/2006/12/w...eo-live-on.html  =================================================================  Tuesday, December 5  World record carp video - live on wednesday The video showing the capture of the world-record 87 lb 2 oz carp is now in the hands of Angling Times reporters. We are in the process of editing the video and will have it live on this website by 5 pm Wednesday afternoon. We apologise for the delay in bringing you this footage.
....Yep, saw a picture of it earlier this morning....
Good god!  What's wrong with it?  Looks like an alien is about to pop out.  Locals should lay off the donuts for bait idea.
HOLY, thats a huge carp,   its a wonder it can even swim........
Looks like it's been sitting on the same couch he caught it on last year.
I think when buddy caught it a year ago he plugged its butt.  That thing looks real bunged up
Well, next year when he catches it it should be over 90lbs, and the year after, over 100!
I wonder if carp is any good in the smoker..... and would it fit? Hmmmmm modifications will be needed I think.  Gerritt.

LOL Gerrit. That would have to be the mother of all smokers.  I would go another route. As BBR would say "Chowda"...you could make gallons of it.  This second catch really doesn't surprise me however. I just finished my 2nd full season of Carpin and have a "swim" in Bobcaygeon I bait regularly. I have caught this one carp with a good scar on it at least 5 times....stupid fish...over the last 2 summers.
That thing is grotesque, not b/c it's a carp, but b/c it's freakishly huge.  Mike
That is probably so true Gbay    It probably never moved from  the spot that it was    caught the first time
I'm good at a lot of things, but I don't smoke dude.  As for fitting in. Well, I have to admit, it wouldn't be a bad thing if I shed a few pounds.
